sub_title: Game Designer helping people create sensational memories to cherish by developing immersive real-life game adventures.
summary:
Your adventures and good stories have tremendous value; they make you happy. Excellent experiences make you happier than buying products. I make real-life games in which you create those stories and live those adventures. 

Harnessing 8 years of game design and entrepreneurial experience from two award-winning videogames, two of the most successful real-life games of the Benelux and countless adventures I organized for my friends, I’m one of the first Game Designers to bring immersive games to real life. More on my entrepreneurial journey and these projects down below at “Experience” and “Projects”. 

Ever since I started trekking around the world, I formed a deep desire to create experiences that make you feel alive. My curiosity takes me to unexpected places providing me with inspiration and new perspectives. With the memory of an elephant, a vivid & endless imagination and a brain that’s lightning fast at finding connections between experiences, I have great ideas and even better solutions.

I once spend a whole day walking around with a gas mask to simulate how it feels to be an astronaut for a space project. Comprehensive research on the theme & subject within the time window helps making intelligent decisions. Creating a believable world matters if you want your players to hide under a bed for 20 minutes out of free will and still say they had the best time of their lives!

I’m on a mission to create tense & thrilling games that will become the next highlight of your life to be printed in your memory to relish and provide you with long-lasting happiness!

projects.title: Red Eye Case: I Can Hear You
projects.description:
I Can Hear You is the first of the line-up of the Red Eye Case universe. Created as the first real-life horror game ever, I Can Hear You blends videogames, escape rooms, haunted houses and interactive theatre all into one tense, scary and highly immersive experience. It was a tremendous successful pilot that completely sold out the whole of 2018, getting stellar reviews all across the board and a lot of media attention with it. The location-based experience takes place in an abandoned hospital in the small town of Maaseik; an unknown destination with a declining population, making the achievements even more impressive. Players need to break into the hospital, solve the mystery, face scary challenges and stay out of the hands of a professional actor all over the course of two hours. 

Tasks: Concept, game design, game mechanics, game flow, worldbuilding, research, story, level design, playtesting, actor casting & training, marketing, PR and product placement.

projects.title: Planetoid Pioneers
projects.description:
Planetoid Pioneers is a physics-driven and community-generated exploration game built on Data Realms’ own Crush2D game engine. The award winning game features multiplayer combat, crafting, and ridiculous physics fails! Players can bring their own game ideas to life with the powerful engine and integrated game development tools. 

Tasks: Game structure, game mechanics, gameplay design, level design, tutorial, puzzle design, playtesting, PR, guerrilla marketing, general advisor.

projects.title: The Flock
projects.description:
The Flock was a highly ambitious asymmetrical multiplayer horror game. It was remarkable for being an award-winning student project that was able to capture the game industry attention worldwide, being featured in over 800+ articles around the web, receiving support from Steam, Xbox, Playstation and Unity, sponsorships from Intel, Razer, Dreamhack and Monster Energy and investment from famous indie developers of Indie Fund. In-game you would switch between roles of the hunter (monster) and the prey in first person, trying to outsmart the other players with stealth gameplay and utilizing game-mechanics inspired from real-life kids games.

Many important lessons were learned from the project. In the end the project proved to be too ambitious for the young team's capabilities, failing to set the world on fire. 

Tasks: Concept, creative direction, game design, game mechanics, gameplay design, level design, worldbuilding, research, playtesting, project management, PR, marketing.

profile_positions.title: Creative Director & Game Designer

profile_positions.description:
Tasks: Game design, level design, concepting & vision, worldbuilding, playtesting, public speaking, marketing strategy.

As a freelance game designer, I do my research thoroughly and develop concepts, solutions, game mechanics, gameplay, theme & story and ensure they all become one coherent experience that immerses players into an unforgettable adventure. 

You can consult me to help improve your game or interactive experience and find the right audience for it. I help bring focus to your project, provide multiple perspectives to find 'blind spots', playtest & gather in-depth feedback from your audience, flesh out (your) design goals and make them more understandable for everyone in the team, achieving better results. With vast industry knowledge and marketing experience I can help strategize how to get the right recognition and coverage for your project, creating hype and anticipation for your experience.

Eager to learn and teach, I share my hard-won lessons in the form of giving talks, joining in on panel discussions, providing workshops for all ages and help gamify events.  

For some of my projects scroll down below and click on them to read more.
profile_positions.title: Game Designer

profile_positions.description:
Tasks: Game design, gameflow & level design, creative directon & concept, worldbuilding & story, playtesting, actor casting & training, pitching, product placement.

Worked on several (unreleased and released) projects. My main job was to help create 'the next escape room' for real-life experiences. Translating game design techniques I learned from making videogames to real-life games lead to innovations for the real-life gaming industry. For these games I served as a creative director and game designer, prototyping game mechanics, fleshing them out into full gameplay loops followed by extensive research before building out the theme, world, gameflow, level design and narrative. I helped from pitching projects to bringing everything together into one concept which we completely build and test on location.
profile_positions.title: Game Designer

profile_positions.description:
Tasks: Game structure, game mechanics, gameplay design, level design, tutorial, playtesting, PR, guerrilla marketing, pitching.

Responsible for pivoting the feature rich Planetoid Pioneers into an exploration physics-based puzzle game, creating a metroidvania-lite structure and levels for it, playtesting regularly to bring in more focus and deciding what mechanics are taught to the player in which way. Translating the vision of the director into workable design goals and boundaries for the team to develop in. I also served as a general consultant in how to bring the game to market, got the game featured on prominent game-outlets and helped win several pitches and prizes for the game.

More on the game itself, look down below at projects.
profile_positions.title: Lead Game Designer

profile_positions.description:
Tasks: Game design, creative direction & concept, level design, worldbuilding, playtesting, PR, marketing, pitching, public speaking, business.

I was one of the three founding members of the team and company. I was responsible for the concept of The Flock from start to finish; creating one of the first horror multiplayer games that worked, designing its mechanics, the gameplay, half of its levels, the whole world and story of the game and serving as a creative director for its audiovisual presentation, design and the overall game experience. I setup hundreds of playtests, ensuring the game was aligned to its design goals on a weekly basis. 

During the first year I led the small team as a project manager, before the team expanded and I turned the responsibility over to someone else. More importantly I was responsible for getting the game featured over a thousand times; getting coverage at big influencers and on all important game-related outlets writing and emailing press releases. I learned how to pitch, talk in public and build anticipation. Together with another team member we got the game approved for all important platforms and brought in prestige investments and sponsorships from world-class developers and brands.     

More on the game itself down below in the section 'projects'.
